On the eighth day of the second month of the second year of Qianfeng, I first built an ordination platform. More than twenty monks from the mountains and rivers of the four directions gathered from afar.
When summer began, the group gathered again, and many received full ordination. Most were from distant places, and fellow students from the capital temples all came to observe the transformation.
I, hoping for the benefits of the Dharma, feared there might be discord;
harmonious and pleasant, I made it a priority to accommodate everyone.

There was Vinaya Master Zhenyi of Ximing Temple in the capital, now a master of the Vinaya, who was most wary of Peng Xiang's valor, fearing that turning east and circumambulating counterclockwise would harm the customs of the time.
I advised him, saying:
Vinaya Master, do not see turning east and circumambulating counterclockwise as non-dharmic!
This is the great principle of the heavenly constant.
People are confused about left and right, and rarely distinguish customs. I deeply hope you will understand this and not worry about it being a fault.
He then replied to me, saying:
I dare not find fault with this.
When I saw the great virtuous Gong Chan Master of Da Zhuangyan Temple practicing the Way, he would always turn east and north, which is circumambulating to the right.
He told me:
Have you not seen the city gates in the secular world? Entering from the east and exiting from the west, all say it is exiting from the left and entering from the right.
It is like this and so on.
In the practice of rituals, observing the timing and system, if it is not pure in other places, then do not perform it.
I am seventy years old, my feet are weak and decrepit, but those who seek the Dharma come from far away, crossing mountains and passes.

This autumn the weather has already cleared, and the minds of guests are flying high. We will part ways for the rest of our lives, and it is certain we will miss the chance to see each other again. I have gathered them with difficulty despite my illness, as a farewell gift for the end of their journey.
Speaking of this, tears flow, and being alone is truly pitiful.
